instruction: What kinds of spectrum was used in the study on classifying soybean varieties?
Output: On classifying soybean varieties,the researchers used visible spectrum and nir spectrum.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used on classifying soybean varieties?
Output: PCA method was adopted to select the optimal feature subset in this study.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance on classifying soybean varieties, and how far can this metric go?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the performance on classifying soybean varieties was the classification accuracy rate. The results showed that the classification accuracy rates in the training set were higher than 96%, and the predicting accuracy rates were all higher than 84%.

instruction: What machine learning models were used in the study to classify soybean varieties based on spectral information?
Output: The machine learning models used in the study to classify soybean varieties based on spectral information were soft independent modelling of class analogy (SIMCA), partial squares discriminant analysis (PLS-DA), genetic algorithm optimized BP neural network (GA-BP), and Takagi-Sugeno fuzzy neural network (T-S fuzzy neural network).

instruction: How does the proposed method combining spectral information and machine learning compare to traditional methods in terms of accuracy and computation cost for classifying soybean varieties?
Output:
The proposed method combining spectral information and machine learning outperforms traditional methods in terms of accuracy for classifying soybean varieties. The average accuracy of the training set was higher than 96% and the average accuracy of the testing set was higher than 84%. This indicates that the method is able to accurately classify soybean varieties.

In terms of computation cost, the Takagi-Sugeno fuzzy neural network (T-S fuzzy neural network) model, which is part of the proposed method, is considered the best choice. It offers better stability and less computation cost compared to other models such as soft independent modelling of class analogy (SIMCA), partial squares discriminant analysis (PLS-DA), and genetic algorithm optimized BP neural network (GA-BP). 

Therefore, the proposed method combining spectral information and machine learning not only provides high accuracy in classifying soybean varieties but also offers a more efficient and cost-effective solution compared to traditional methods.
